comment: If you decide to Social Psyc don't count Dr. Barlett out. I was skeptical at first because of the negative reviews, but she was my only option, and I do not regret taking her. I took her for a 7-week II session, and it was a lot of reading. She is very test-heavy, so prepare to study hard. She drops a lot of grades, which makes it easy to get an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
*PSYC 2500*

Actually surprised by the low rating for Dr. B. I found her to be pretty straightforward, but there is a lot of work and it is a difficult class. Stay on top of your deadlines and do all of your assignments: they help you with the final paper. She gives great feedback, so if you're confused, ASK!

PSYC2500* Her lack of any substantial lectures whatsoever made Research Methods much harder than it should've been. Weekly chapter, Inquizitive, and quiz (& lots of discussion posts w/two replies). Lots of APA practice plus a 10-15 pg Lit Review. All quizzes Lockdown w/webcam (two attempts, different questions for each attempt), aside from Final.

The tests were nothing like what we learned in the textbook, and she does very little to help the class prepare. She also is very rude to many students when addressed in email, and is unwilling to help
there was a LOT of work, the tests were VERY hard and you must use lockdown browser with webcam and the prof stresses she checks every recording. still got an A tho

very tough for an intro class. exams on lockdown, are pretty tough, very example based. 
lots of busy work, but that was the only thing keeping my grade up, I recommend doing all homework to boost your grade. Nothing negative to say about Dr. B herself, just a tough class. Have to devote a lot of time, and this class was not one I had to take.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: extremely hard exams. Heavy work load, way to difficult for a intro psyc class. Not very helpful even though the entire class fails the exams.

For the first psych class, this feels like alot of work. Alot of text book readings and homework based on it as well. There are weekly quizzes not lockdown. However the tests are lockdown with camera along with short answers during the test. The test are more difficult because they are example based now definition based.

Extremely hard for an introductory class. The exams are lockdown browser and include multiple short answer questions which are insanely difficult unless you are already a master in psychology. On top of that weekly work load is heavy. Every week there is a 20 question quiz, discussion post and you must reply to someone, and 3 text book assignments.
